objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre is the publisher/author of the report and the YARA rules included within it.

objects.name: libsophos.so (copied malware path)
objects.description: Malicious shared object copied/dropped here for LD_PRELOAD persistence on victim devices

objects.name: .sshd.ipc
objects.description: Unix domain socket created by Pygmy Goat for backdoor SSH C2 data forwarding

objects.name: .fgmon_cli.ipc
objects.description: Alternative IPC Unix client socket used by Pygmy Goat (observed in sample; suggests FortiGate targeting)

objects.name: .goat.ipc
objects.description: IPC Unix server socket path used by older Pygmy Goat sample

objects.name: sshd.pid
objects.description: Single-instance PID lock file created by Pygmy Goat to ensure only one instance executes

objects.name: sshdd.pid
objects.description: Single-instance PID lock file path observed in Pygmy Goat (indicator listed in Detection)

objects.name: goat.pid
objects.description: Single-instance PID lock file path used by older Pygmy Goat sample

objects.description: MD5 of Pygmy Goat malicious shared object loaded into /bin/sshd (current variant)

objects.description: SHA-1 of Pygmy Goat malicious shared object loaded into /bin/sshd (current variant)

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of Pygmy Goat malicious shared object loaded into /bin/sshd (current variant)

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of earlier Pygmy Goat variant (VMProtect-obfuscated; lacks reverse proxy functionality)

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of earlier Pygmy Goat variant (VMProtect-obfuscated; lacks reverse proxy functionality)

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (SHA256)

objects.name: pygmy goat
objects.description: Pygmy Goat is a native x86-32 ELF shared object (libsophos.so) discovered on Sophos XG firewall devices that provides backdoor access by leveraging LD_PRELOAD to inject into /bin/sshd and hook its accept function. It listens on a raw ICMP socket for encrypted port-knock packets containing a C2 IP/port (AES-256-CBC) and also monitors SSH connections for specific magic bytes (SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_5.3p1) to trigger a fake SSH handshake and then a TLS session. The malware verifies the C2 using an embedded CA certificate masquerading as Fortinet, establishes encrypted C2 channels over TLS, and supports multiple commands: remote /bin/sh and /bin/csh shells, starting a packet capture via libpcap, creating cron tasks through an embedded BusyBox-driven crontab, and spinning up a reverse SOCKS5 proxy by embedding EarthWorm code. It uses Unix sockets for IPC, ensures single-instance execution via a PID file, unsets LD_PRELOAD to evade casual forensics, compresses C2 data with LZO1X, and contains an earlier VMProtect-obfuscated variant lacking reverse proxy functionality.

objects.name: castletap
objects.description: Referenced by Mandiant as part of attacks on FortiGate devices, CASTLETAP exhibits TTPs similar to Pygmy Goat, including the use of an encrypted ICMP packet carrying C2 information to establish a reverse SSL connection.

objects.name: Mandiant
objects.description: Security vendor cited for reporting on attacks against FortiGate devices and for prior observations of EarthWorm usage.

objects.name: CrowdStrike
objects.description: Security vendor cited for prior reporting noting threat actor use of EarthWorm.

objects.name: Sophos
objects.description: Vendor of the Sophos XG firewall devices on which Pygmy Goat was discovered.

objects.name: Fortinet Ltd.
objects.description: Network device vendor whose brand (FortiGate) appears in the embedded Root CA certificate used by Pygmy Goat to validate its TLS C2.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_aes_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_magic_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule pygmy_goat_magic_strings
{

meta:

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Pygmy Goat magic byte sequences used in C2 comms"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"

strings:

$c2_magic_handshake = ",bEB3?=o"
$fake_ssh_banner = "SSH-2.0-D8pjE"
$fake_ed25519_key = { 29 cc f0 cc 16 c5 46 6e 52 19 82 8e 86

65 42 8c 1f 1a d4 c3 a5 b1 cb fc c0 26 6c 31 3c 5c 90 3a 24 7d e4 d3 57
6d da 8e cb f4 66 d1 cb 81 4f 63 fd 4a fa 06 e4 7e 4c a0 95 91 bd cb 97
a4 b3 0f }

condition:

(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and any of them

}

objects.name: earthworm_id_generation_x86
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule earthworm_id_generation_x86
{

meta:

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "EarthWorm pool num generation x86 assembly"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"

strings:

$chartoi = {

8b 45 ??        // MOV
c1 e0 07        // SHL
89 c1           // MOV
8b 55 ??        // MOV
8b 45 ??        // MOV
01 d0           // ADD
0f b6 00        // MOVZX
0f be c0        // MOVSX
01 c8           // ADD
89 45 ??        // MOV
83 6d ?? 01     // SUB

EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,0x7
ECX,EAX
EDX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,EDX
EAX,byte ptr [EAX]
EAX,AL
EAX,ECX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],EAX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],0x1

}

condition:

}

(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and all of them

objects.name: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses the LD_PRELOAD environment variable to inject into sshd.

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a /bin/sh or /bin/csh remote shell.

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Cron
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create arbitrary cron tasks using crontab.

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses Unix sockets for inter-process communication between parent and forked child processes.

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can use libpcap to sniff network traffic according to a BPF filter and exfiltrate it to the C2.

objects.name: Traffic Signaling: Port Knocking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat listens on an ICMP raw socket for encrypted packets containing magic bytes and the C2 address to connect back to.

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol Impersonation
objects.description: Pygmy Goat responds to an SSH connection that sends magic bytes with a fake SSH handshake.

objects.name: Encrypted Channel: Asymmetric Cryptography
objects.description: Pygmy Goat encrypts C2 communications with TLS.

objects.name: Protocol Tunneling
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a reverse SOCKS5 proxy server to tunnel traffic through it.

objects.name: Archive Collected Data: Archive via Library
objects.description: Pygmy Goat compresses its C2 communications with LZO1X.

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: Pygmy Goat exfiltrates its result data over its C2 channel.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Pygmy Goat
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. pygmy goat.
